amendment.description: Amendments delete language protecting the new child survival account from other laws; maintain a prohibition transferring funds from development assistance to other accounts; restate that funding for Russia and the states of the former Soviet Union will be used for limited purposes; and lower the ratio of private to public funds to 1 to 1, that the former states must raise to qualify for certain funding.
amendment.purpose: An amendment consisting of several amendments offered en bloc and printed as amendment No. 1 in Part I of House Rept. 104-147, to delete the waiver in the bill protecting the new Child Survival Program account from other laws and to retain the prohibition in current law against transferring funds from development assistance to other accounts such as debt restructuring, and for other purposes.

action.text: On agreeing to the Gilman amendments (A001) Agreed to by voice vote.
